author: Brax

review: I just wanted to re-post comments since I have used this device for a while. I have seen a lot of comments about the remote and totally agree that it is pretty useless. I have a windows phone and downloaded the Roku app. It works great it is available for android and apple also. For one thing it is big and lit up, I am 62 yrs old and my eyesight isn't what it once was. Now i see all the buttons. I have never had to reset the stick or had any disruptions. But I have Cox high speed internet and get 50 Mbps so the streaming is flawless. I think some of the problems people are having is more with their ISP than the unit. For those people with inferior internet I would suggest a Roku that has an Ethernet connection. That way you avoid having to use WiFi.As far as smart TV's my son has one and i get a far better experience with Roku. For one thing both hulu and Netflix have a different interface when using Roku. You also get Acorn TV for those who really like British shows and PBS app that lets you see all the antique road shows on demand. crackle, YouTube and vevo, as well as amazon prime. there are free channels for those who like really old Westerns like early John Wayne or Gene Autry. also scary movies like Dracula and the wolf man. If my wife wasn't so tech challenged i would have got rid of cable long ago and just used over the air for football.I own a chromecst also and think the roku is far superior.Someone posted they hated Roku but loved Amazon customer service. Well I love Roku and love Amazon customer service. I work for a very very very large retailer and I shop Amazon. The pricing is great and I have never had any problem with the companies that sell their items here. THANKS AMAZON KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK.
